column1: Urgently we are looking For OT Store Executive
column2: Responsibilities Job Activities :  Assisting to Purchase Dept. personnels. Manage Inventory Control. Storage of material in Central and Sub Stores. Store medical consumables based on requirement   of stores area. Follow up with vendors for Expiry of the   materials and get fresh stock replaced from them. Promoting for development of short and   long-term goals and objectives within our department. Providing professional services to the various   indenting departments. Periodical stock verification of the   materials. Gate pass preparation of returnable & non   returnable materials. Maintaining good working relationship among   department personnel, medical staff, other hospital employees and patients. Supporting all   other departments in the hospital after office hours as far as material   requirement is concerned. Maintains open line   of communication Communication with   the vendors for smooth inflow of material ordered by Purchase Dept. or non   availability of particular item. To ensure that any   material required on emergency basis without purchase requisition shall be   made available on time to take care of patient. Adopting hospital   policies and procedures pertaining to safety of materials being stored. Implementing   continuous quality improvement initiatives and activities initiated by Head   of Department. Materials   dispensing & charging to the respective patients & departments. Ensure that all the   material is kept in the Stores in proper condition. Follow up with   vendors for dispatch and delivery. Resolving new issues   required for the departments. Monitoring the   inventory, so as to achieve at optimum level. To ensure the   proper storage of materials and good housekeeping in Stores. To keep all the   records in order.  Store General Items   & Medical consumables based on requirement of stores. MIS Reports Current Stock   Report Reorder Level ABC Analysis Patient charging   materials. For more details kindly contact on : 8879688633

column2: Provide critical medical support for pain and symptom control and other palliative care needs to palliative care patients through the palliative care team      Work as part of multi-disciplinary palliative care team in ensuring excellent patient care services and carrying out quality improvement initiatives        Essential Duties and Responsibilities:        Daily visits to patients homes/patients in OPC to provide consultation in palliative care, symptom management and supportive care to the patient and to meet the general medical needs of the patient to the extent that these are not met by treating      Facilitate clarification of patient and family goals of care      Consult with the team to establish a written plan of care      Educate patients and/or caregivers on patient s condition, progress of disease and end-of-life care and issues      Out-of-hours phone triage      Maintenance of patient record      Maintenance of Morphine record      Work as part of a multi-disciplinary team and assist nurse and counselor as required      Education of staff and coworkers      Attend fortnightly coordination meetings at headquarters      Participate in continuing education training programs for palliative care staff during      Participate in outstation trainings as decided by Palliative care Director      Assist in in-house training sessions as decided by Palliative care Director      Perform other duties as requested      Adhere to the practice of confidentiality regarding patients, families, staff, and the      Additional Duties and Responsibilities:      Participate in events held by CanSupport such as:      - Bereaved families (Remembrance Day)      - Fundraising (Walk for Life).        Job Qualifications:        MBBS/Equivalent degree from outside India plus registration in India      5 years experience as physician in hospital or community setting      Computer Skills

Responsibilities           Evaluate patients vital signs and laboratory data to determine emergency intervention needs     Check inventory, ensure that the equipment and other articles are kept in proper place in working condition and report to shift in charge. Identify malfunctioning equipment or devices report to shift in charge     Administer blood and blood products, monitoring patients for signs and symptoms related to transfusion reactions.     Advocate for patients and families needs, or provide emotional support for patients and their families.     Assist physicians with procedures such as bronchoscopy, endoscopy, endotracheal intubation, and CPR.     Keep constant watch on patient and identify any abnormal deviation in the patient s condition and inform the doctor immediately.     Ensure that the doctor visits the patient and start the treatment without delay.     Maintain accurate patient records from admission to discharge.     Communicate effectively with health team and other support services.     Strictly adhere to the infection control policy like hand washing, use of gloves, barrier nursing and sterile technique as required.     Dispose waste as per policy.         Qualification and experience         Bachelor?? degree in nursing or diploma from a Recognized nursing college.     An experience of 2-3 years in Medical/ Surgical ICU.     ACLS Basic life support certification     Basic computer literacy and good knowledge of a Hospital Information System     Mandatory registration with Delhi Nursing Council.

column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for MICU Nurse to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     The MICU Nurse plays a critical role in providing high-quality care to patients in the Medical Intensive Care Unit (MICU)     They are responsible for the assessment, planning, implementation, and evaluation of nursing care for patients with complex medical conditions requiring intensive monitoring and treatment       Key Responsibilities:       Patient Assessment: Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients' health status upon admission and throughout their stay in the MICU     Monitor vital signs, assess symptoms, and evaluate responses to treatment     Care Planning: Develop individualized care plans based on patients' medical history, diagnosis, and treatment goals     Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to establish priorities and interventions to achieve optimal outcomes     Nursing Interventions: Administer medications, treatments, and procedures as prescribed by physicians     Monitor patients closely, including ventilator management, hemodynamic monitoring, and other critical care interventions     Patient Education: Educate patients and their families about their condition, treatment plan, and self-care techniques     Provide support and guidance to promote understanding and adherence to medical recommendations     Multidisciplinary Collaboration: Work closely with physicians, respiratory therapists, pharmacists, and other healthcare professionals to coordinate care and ensure continuity of treatment     Participate in multidisciplinary rounds and care conferences     Documentation: Maintain accurate and thorough documentation of patient assessments, interventions, and outcomes in the electronic medical record     Ensure compliance with regulatory standards and organizational policies     Patient Advocacy: Advocate for patients' needs and preferences, ensuring their voice is heard in the decision-making process     Collaborate with the healthcare team to address ethical dilemmas and promote patient-centered care     Emergency Response: Respond promptly to changes in patients' condition, initiating appropriate interventions in emergency situations     Stay calm under pressure and collaborate effectively with team members to provide timely and efficient care     Quality Improvement: Participate in quality improvement initiatives to enhance patient care processes and outcomes     Identify opportunities for improvement and contribute to evidence-based practice initiatives     Professional Development: Pursue ongoing education and training to enhance clinical skills and stay updated on advances in critical care nursing practice     Maintain licensure and certifications required for MICU nursing practice

column2: Job Description     The nurse will assess the needs of the patients:     Take complete case history from relatives, also read all patients health records available.     If the recent discharge from a hospital, instructions on the discharge card/ summary to be followed.     The nursing care plan will be prepared based on needs of the patient along with the involvement of Head of Nursing at Arooj. The nurse will then share this care plan with the family.     Clinical documentation will be maintained on shift basis:      Vitals Monitoring Chart     Intake Output     Medication Chart     Shift handover to the new nurse in detail explaining the events of the previous shift.      The nurse will give direct patient care: ? Bed making, changing of bed sheets, mouth care, back care, bed bath, hair wash, changing of position, fulfil all basic needs (hygienic need, nutritional need etc.) of the patients. ? Nurse will provide comfort to the patient and maintain the safety of the patient. ? Nurse will monitor the condition and take care of a patient. ? Nurse will also assist the patient with reading, write or take the patient out for a stroll. ? For terminally ill patients, the nurse at home will carry all palliative treatment as instructed by the family doc/ consultant which may include but is not limited to ? pain management with medication.     Maintaining a Safe home environment: ? Arranging patients room and consumables used in patient care. ? Safe use of equipment?s (bed and machines) and get daily cleaning of equipment?s done from a family appointed person/ attendant. ? Ensuring neat and clean patient surroundings. ? Taking care of the patient care equipment and machines. ? Collecting Biomedical waste separately in garbage bags and infectious waste to be discarded separately. ? Ensuring sharps to be discarded carefully.     Patient Safety:     Patient?s falls     pressure ulcers (bed sores)     aspiration pneumonia     catheter related infections     wound care     maintaining daily communication with patient and relatives and if needed with treating physician about the condition of the patient. Qualifications GNM / BSC / ANM  GNM   BSC   ANM

column2: you will be an essential member of our healthcare team, providing direct care and support to patients under the supervision of licensed nurses and medical staff     Your compassionate and skilled assistance will contribute to the well-being and comfort of our patients         Key Responsibilities         Patient Care:Assist patients with activities of daily living (ADLs), including bathing, grooming, dressing, feeding, and toileting     Provide support and comfort to patients in their daily routines     Vital Signs Monitoring:Take and record vital signs such as blood pressure, pulse, temperature, and respiration     Report any unusual readings or concerns to the nursing staff     Mobility and Positioning:Help patients with mobility, repositioning, and transferring to prevent bedsores and maintain their physical well-being     Assist with ambulation and the use of mobility aids     Medical Equipment:Set up and assist with medical equipment and devices as required for patient care     Maintain the cleanliness and functionality of equipment     Documentation:Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including care plans, observations, and any changes in patient conditions     Patient Monitoring:Observe and report changes in patients' physical and mental conditions to the nursing staff     Assist in addressing patient concerns and requests     Infection Control:Follow infection control procedures to prevent the spread of illness and maintain a clean and safe environment     Meal Assistance:Assist patients with meal preparation, feeding, and monitoring dietary requirements     Ensure patients receive proper nutrition and hydration     Comfort and Emotional Support:Offer emotional support to patients and their families, fostering a compassionate and empathetic environment     Compliance and Training:Adhere to healthcare regulations, protocols, and policies     Participate in ongoing training and professional development

column2: HORIZAN WELNESS HOSPITAL is looking for Nursing Staff to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      We are seeking dedicated and compassionate individuals to join our nursing staff      As a member of our nursing team, you will play a critical role in providing high-quality patient care, promoting a safe and healing environment, and supporting the overall functioning of our healthcare facility        Key Responsibilities:        Patient Care: Provide direct patient care and assist with activities of daily living, including bathing, feeding, mobility, and medication administration      Monitor and record vital signs, assess patients' conditions, and report any changes or concerns to the appropriate healthcare professionals      Ensure patients' comfort and well-being while respecting their privacy and dignity      Nursing Procedures: Perform various nursing procedures, such as wound care, IV therapy, catheterization, and administration of medications as prescribed by physicians      Follow established protocols and standards of practice to ensure patient safety and infection control      Adhere to medication administration guidelines and maintain accurate medication records      Care Planning and Documentation: Participate in the development and implementation of patient care plans in collaboration with the healthcare team      Document patient assessments, interventions, and outcomes accurately and timely in electronic medical records or other designated systems      Maintain confidentiality of patient information and adhere to HIPAA regulations      Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with interdisciplinary healthcare professionals, including physicians, therapists, and support staff, to ensure effective coordination of patient care      Communicate pertinent information to the healthcare team during shift handovers and report any significant changes or incidents promptly      Engage in open and respectful communication with patients, their families, and caregivers      Patient Education: Provide education to patients and their families regarding their healthcare needs, treatments, and medications      Offer guidance on disease prevention, health promotion, and self-care techniques      Ensure patients understand their treatment plans, discharge instructions, and follow-up care requirements      Safety and Compliance: Adhere to safety protocols and infection control measures to maintain a safe and clean environment for patients, staff, and visitors      Comply with all regulatory standards, policies, and procedures relevant to nursing practice      Identify and report any safety hazards or equipment malfunctions      Professional Development: Stay updated on current nursing practices, evidence-based guidelines, and industry trends through continuing education and professional development activities      Seek opportunities to enhance clinical skills and knowledge, contributing to the delivery of high-quality patient care

column2: MJM Hospital is looking for NICU Nursing Staff to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      We are currently seeking dedicated and compassionate NICU Nursing Staff to join our dynamic healthcare team      The NICU Nursing Staff will be responsible for providing specialized nursing care to premature and critically ill newborns in our Neonatal Intensive Care Unit      The ideal candidates will have a strong background in neonatal nursing, exceptional clinical skills, and a commitment to delivering high-quality patient care        Responsibilities:        Patient Care:Provide direct patient care to newborns admitted to the NICU, including monitoring vital signs, administering medications, and performing medical procedures      Collaborate with healthcare providers to develop and implement individualized care plans      Assessment and Monitoring:Conduct ongoing assessments of neonatal patients, identifying changes in condition and responding promptly      Utilize advanced monitoring equipment to track vital signs and physiological parameters      Family Support:Educate and support parents and family members on the care of their newborn in the NICU      Foster a supportive and compassionate environment for families facing challenging circumstances      Collaboration:Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, including neonatologists, respiratory therapists, and other healthcare professionals, to ensure comprehensive care      Participate in patient rounds, case conferences, and team meetings      Documentation:Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records, including nursing assessments, care plans, and patient progress notes      Adhere to documentation standards and protocols      Infection Control:Implement and adhere to infection control practices to ensure the safety of neonatal patients      Follow established protocols for aseptic techniques and cleanliness      Professional Development:Stay current with advancements in neonatal nursing by attending relevant training, workshops, and continuing education programs      Pursue professional certifications related to neonatal care
column11: Training, Administration, Nursing Staff, intensive care, Patient care, Healthcare, NICU, medical records, Monitoring

column2: Responsible for complete bedside nursing care of their assigned patients.     Carry out procedures of admission, transfer and discharge.     Makes beds of serious patients and helps or guides staffs under her to make beds, by supplying linen     Maintains personal hygiene and comfort of the patient     Attends to the nutritional needs of the patient and feeds the helpless patients     Maintains clean and safe environment for the patient     Implements and maintains ward policies and routines.     Co-ordinates patient care with other team members.     Take round with the doctors when called to list new orders and see that they are carried out.     Performs various technical tasks related to nursing care.     Administration of medication, i.e. tablets, injections. Infusions and transfusion on prescription, or according to standing instructions.     Assisting doctors in various medical and surgical diagnostic procedures by preparing patients.     Collecting and sending of specimens for laboratory diagnostic procedures     Oversee monitor recording of vital signs, i.e. temperature, pulse, respiration and blood pressure.     Performing gastric lavage, administering enema and/or suppository etc.     Prepares patients for operations and see that the patient is sent to operation theatre with all necessary papers and medications.     Takes care of eyes, ears, back, bowel, bladder, perineum and breast etc.     Observes all patients conditions and take suitable action accordingly and / or the doctor     Give expert bedside nursing care to all patients     . Attends last offices in case of a patient dying during shifts and arrange to preserve dead body in mortuary, or hand over the body with respect to concerned family members, relatives/ authorities.     Help the ward in charge to carry out her/his work or act as ward in charge during his/ her absence.     Maintains general cleanliness of the ward and the sanitary annexure     Supervises the duties of supportive staffs and guides them and reports accordingly     Writes the diet register and supervises the distribution of diet report if any, necessary     Maintains scheduled poisonous drug registers     Supervises nursing care and other tasks carried out by the students     Maintains duty room trays, sterilize instruments and see that procedural trays are in readiness     Take over from duty nurse of the previous, new and serious patients, instruments, supplies, drugs etc. and handover the same accordingly     Maintains all records pertaining to ward/unit     Maintains case papers, investigation reports etc.     Maintains vital signs charts, intake-output charts and other special charts if necessary.     Takes special care of medico legal case papers and records.     Writes day and night orders and maintains ward statistics.     Enters all chargeable procedures, references etc. in patients file.     Checks files for every entry.     Enters charges of every single procedure in the patients file.     Stores original reports of all company or insurance patients     Any other duties assigned by the nursing HOD from time to time.

column2: To contribute to the delivery of high-quality nursing care to ICU patients.              Responsibilities        1. Evaluate and monitor the patient s progress.      2. Identify sudden or subtle changes in a patient s medical condition.      3. Deliver regular updates to doctors, patients, and their family members.      4. Begin treatment and monitor doses.      5. If necessary, respond to a medical emergency and alert the appropriate doctors.      6. Care for patient needs throughout their recovery in the ICU unit.      7. Complete all necessary paperwork before transferring a patient.      8. Maintain patient records.      9. Maintain the ICU registers regularly.      10. Create and implement effective care plans      11. Demonstrate brilliant empathy and communication skills.      12. To follow the doctors instructions in case files, as regards administering of medicines, investigations etc., and report to the doctors, if required immediately.      13. To write nurses notes properly with name date time & signature      14. To complete Nursing initial assessment of patients admitted within 10-15 minutes of Admission      15. Ensure proper sterilization and disinfection of the equipment according to the requirement      16. Daily checking of Emergency drugs before start of duty      17. To label the medicine with drug name ,strength and expiry date for prepared medicine or medicine stored in other than its original container      18. To follow hand hygiene and use of Personal Protective Equipment appropriately      19. To dispose Bio medical waste as per hospital policy      20. To take over charge of patients on duty and attend to their medical needs as per doctors instructions till the time of handling over charge to the reliever.      21. To ensure that the patient is prepared, made ready in time when a case in posted for surgery.      22. To be responsible while shifting the patients from and to other departments for investigations, treatment etc., and further follow up actions      23. To collect and send the blood, urine, stool etc., sample for investigations through the ward boys as when required with follow up actions.      24. Maintain stock in ward and Indent things from main store.
column11: Administration, Usage, Nursing, Emergency Nurse, GNM, Indenting, ICU, biomedical, Monitoring
